text: In Problem 1.1 A, Daphne used ratio relationships to solve the mystery. She reasoned:

For every inch measured on the PI magazine, there are 10 inches of the PI magazine in real life. I used the PI magazine height to measure the height of the teacher. The teacher is 7 PI magazines tall. So, in real life the teacher is 7 x 10 inches or 70 inches tall.

Daphneâ€™s reasoning is similar to the reasoning you have done in the _Comparing Quantities_ unit where you used ratios to describe and compare quantities. Recall that a **ratio** is a comparison of two quantities which have a multiplicative relationship, such as two lengths.

• 1 PI magazine height to the height of the teacher (7 PI magazines)
  • **or**
  • 1 PI magazine: 7 PI magazines
  • **or**
  • 10 in: 70 in
Using ratio relationships to solve problems is also called proportional reasoning.
